name: QuAC
summary: Question Answering in Context is a dialogue-style QA dataset with 14k information-seeking Q&A dialogs (100k questions total) about Wikipedia articles​:contentReference[oaicite:27]{index=27}. A student asks a series of questions and a teacher provides extractive answers from the text, or a special "CANNOTANSWER" if unanswerable.
size: 13,594 dialogs with 98,407 QA pairs​:contentReference[oaicite:28]{index=28}. (~83k train questions, 7k dev, 7k test).
download: https://quac.ai/ (provides train/dev data JSON). Also on HuggingFace as `quac`.
notes: QuAC involves context retention across turns (each question comes with dialog history). Answers are spans from passages and often require the context of previous Q&A. It also includes teacher’s dialogue acts and answer summaries for some turns.
